intro: Carallia confinis var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed carallia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the eastern United States, particularly in the Appalachian region, where it thrives in moist, wooded habitats. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface and produces small, clustered greenish-white flowers. It is often found growing along stream banks and in shaded understories of forests. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species for ecological studies and native plant gardens.
